name: py-pytest

A Python library for parsing and creating TOML configuration files. For

lang/toml.git

dependencies.description: Additions to the standard Python itertools package.

dependencies.name: py-wcwidth

dependent_to.name: py-pytest-forked
dependent_to.description: Run tests in isolated forked subprocesses.

dependent_to.name: py-pytest-mock
dependent_to.description: Thin-wrapper around the mock package for easier use with py.test

dependent_to.name: py-pytest-random-order
dependent_to.description: Randomise the order in which pytest tests are run.

dependent_to.name: py-pytest-xdist
dependent_to.description: py.test xdist plugin for distributed testing and loop-on-failing mode

dependent_to.name: n2p2
dependent_to.description:
N2p2 (The neural network potential package) provides ready-to-use
software for high-dimensional neural network potentials in computational
physics and chemistry.

dependent_to.name: py-pytest-cache
dependent_to.description:
pytest plugin to provide cross-test run caching functionality to plugins
and test runs.

dependent_to.name: py-pytest-timeout
dependent_to.description:
A plugin which will terminate tests after a certain timeout, assuming
the test session isn't being debugged.

dependent_to.name: py-matplotlib
dependent_to.description:
Matplotlib is a comprehensive library for creating static, animated, and
interactive visualizations in Python.

dependent_to.name: phist
dependent_to.description:
The Pipelined, Hybrid-parallel Iterative Solver Toolkit provides
implementations of and interfaces to block iterative solvers for sparse
linear and eigenvalue problems. In contrast to other libraries we
support multiple backends (e.g. Trilinos, PETSc and our own optimized
kernels), and interfaces in multiple languages such as C, C++, Fortran
2003 and Python. PHIST has a clear focus on portability and hardware
performance: in particular support row-major storage of block vectors
and using GPUs (via the ghost library or Trilinos/Tpetra).

dependent_to.name: gaudi
dependent_to.description: An experiment-independent HEP event data processing framework

dependent_to.name: py-astropy
dependent_to.description:
The Astropy Project is a community effort to develop a single core
package for Astronomy in Python and foster interoperability between
Python astronomy packages.

dependent_to.name: neuron
dependent_to.description:
NEURON is a simulation environment for single and networks of neurons.
NEURON is a simulation environment for modeling individual and networks
of neurons. NEURON models individual neurons via the use of sections
that are automatically subdivided into individual compartments, instead
of requiring the user to manually create compartments.

dependent_to.name: py-pytest-mypy
dependent_to.description: Mypy static type checker plugin for Pytest.

dependent_to.name: py-pytest-cov
dependent_to.description: Pytest plugin for measuring coverage.

dependent_to.name: py-pytest-qt
dependent_to.description:
A pytest plugin that allows programmers to write tests for PySide,
PySide2 and PyQt applications.

dependent_to.name: py-pytest-benchmark
dependent_to.description: A pytest fixture for benchmarking code.

dependent_to.name: py-pytest-isort
dependent_to.description: py.test plugin to check import ordering using isort

dependent_to.name: py-psyclone
dependent_to.description:
Code generation for the PSyKAl framework from the GungHo project, as
used by the LFRic model at the UK Met Office.

dependent_to.name: py-pytest-html
dependent_to.description:
pytest-html is a plugin for pytest that generates a HTML report for test
results

dependent_to.name: py-scikit-learn
dependent_to.description: A set of python modules for machine learning and data mining.

dependent_to.name: open3d
dependent_to.description: Open3D: A Modern Library for 3D Data Processing.

dependent_to.name: py-pytest-metadata
dependent_to.description: pytest plugin for test session metadata

dependent_to.name: acts
dependent_to.description:
A Common Tracking Software (Acts) This project contains an experiment-
independent set of track reconstruction tools. The main philosophy is to
provide high-level track reconstruction modules that can be used for any
tracking detector. The description of the tracking detector's geometry
is optimized for efficient navigation and quick extrapolation of tracks.
Converters for several common geometry description languages exist.
Having a highly performant, yet largely customizable implementation of
track reconstruction algorithms was a primary objective for the design
of this toolset. Additionally, the applicability to real-life HEP
experiments plays major role in the development process. Apart from
algorithmic code, this project also provides an event data model for the
description of track parameters and measurements. Key features of this
project include: tracking geometry description which can be constructed
from TGeo, DD4Hep, or GDML input, simple and efficient event data model,
performant and highly flexible algorithms for track propagation and
fitting, basic seed finding algorithms.

dependent_to.name: py-slurm-pipeline
dependent_to.description: A Python class for scheduling SLURM jobs

dependent_to.name: py-rpy2
dependent_to.description:
rpy2 is a redesign and rewrite of rpy. It is providing a low-level
interface to R from Python, a proposed high-level interface, including
wrappers to graphical libraries, as well as R-like structures and
functions.

dependent_to.name: py-torchgeo
dependent_to.description:
TorchGeo: datasets, transforms, and models for geospatial data. TorchGeo
is a PyTorch domain library, similar to torchvision, that provides
datasets, transforms, samplers, and pre-trained models specific to
geospatial data.

dependent_to.name: py-pytest-cpp
dependent_to.description: Use pytest runner to discover and execute C++ tests.

dependent_to.name: py-motmetrics
dependent_to.description:
The py-motmetrics library provides a Python implementation of metrics
for benchmarking multiple object trackers (MOT).

dependent_to.name: py-pytest-flakes
dependent_to.description: py.test plugin for efficiently checking python source with pyflakes.

dependent_to.name: py-goatools
dependent_to.description: Python scripts to find enrichment of GO terms

dependent_to.name: py-py2cairo
dependent_to.description: Pycairo is a set of Python bindings for the cairo graphics library.

dependent_to.name: py-pytest-arraydiff
dependent_to.description: pytest plugin to help with comparing array output from tests

dependent_to.name: votca
dependent_to.description:
VOTCA is a software package which focuses on the analysis of molecular
dynamics data, the development of systematic coarse-graining techniques
as well as methods used for simulating microscopic charge (and exciton)
transport in disordered semiconductors.

dependent_to.name: py-pytest-openfiles
dependent_to.description:
A plugin for the pytest framework that allows developers to detect
whether any file handles or other file-like objects were inadvertently
left open at the end of a unit test

dependent_to.name: py-accimage
dependent_to.description:
An accelerated Image loader and preprocessor leveraging Intel IPP.
accimage mimics the PIL API and can be used as a backend for
torchvision.

dependent_to.name: py-pytest-flake8
dependent_to.description: pytest plugin to check FLAKE8 requirements.

dependent_to.name: py-pytest-parallel
dependent_to.description: A pytest plugin for parallel and concurrent testing.

dependent_to.name: py-pytest-doctestplus
dependent_to.description: Pytest plugin with advanced doctest features.

dependent_to.name: py-statsmodels
dependent_to.description: Statistical computations and models for use with SciPy

dependent_to.name: dd4hep
dependent_to.description:
DD4hep is a software framework for providing a complete solution for
full detector description (geometry, materials, visualization, readout,
alignment, calibration, etc.) for the full experiment life cycle
(detector concept development, detector optimization, construction,
operation). It offers a consistent description through a single source
of detector information for simulation, reconstruction, analysis, etc.
It distributed under the LGPLv3 License.

dependent_to.name: py-fava
dependent_to.description:
Fava is a web interface for the double-entry bookkeeping software
Beancount with a focus on features and usability.

dependent_to.name: py-testinfra
dependent_to.description:
With Testinfra you can write unit tests in Python to test actual state
of your servers configured by management tools like Salt, Ansible,
Puppet, Chef and so on.

dependent_to.name: py-numpy
dependent_to.description:
NumPy is the fundamental package for scientific computing with Python.
It contains among other things: a powerful N-dimensional array object,
sophisticated (broadcasting) functions, tools for integrating C/C++ and
Fortran code, and useful linear algebra, Fourier transform, and random
number capabilities

dependent_to.name: py-scipy
dependent_to.description:
SciPy (pronounced "Sigh Pie") is a Scientific Library for Python. It
provides many user-friendly and efficient numerical routines such as
routines for numerical integration and optimization.

dependent_to.name: py-pybind11
dependent_to.description:
pybind11 -- Seamless operability between C++11 and Python. pybind11 is a
lightweight header-only library that exposes C++ types in Python and
vice versa, mainly to create Python bindings of existing C++ code. Its
goals and syntax are similar to the excellent Boost.Python library by
David Abrahams: to minimize boilerplate code in traditional extension
modules by inferring type information using compile-time introspection.

dependent_to.name: py-wub
dependent_to.description:
Bioinformatics tools and a software library developed by the Oxford
Nanopore Technologies Applications group.

dependent_to.name: py-fury
dependent_to.description: Free Unified Rendering in Python.

dependent_to.name: py-geeup
dependent_to.description: Simple Client for Earth Engine Uploads with Selenium Support.

dependent_to.name: py-nbmake
dependent_to.description: Pytest plugin for testing notebooks.

dependent_to.name: py-pytest-pep8
dependent_to.description: pytest plugin for efficiently checking PEP8 compliance

dependent_to.name: py-fparser
dependent_to.description: Parser for Fortran 77..2003 code.

dependent_to.name: py-shapely
dependent_to.description: Manipulation and analysis of geometric objects in the Cartesian plane.
